---
title: Theme
description: Configure Radix-backed colors plus extend styling with CSS and Tailwind.
---

import {ThemeShowcase} from "@canopy-iiif/app/ui/server";

# Theme

Canopy exposes a single `theme` block in `canopy.yml` to control the site-wide accent palette, gray
palette, and base appearance. These values feed the Radix Themes token system and the Tailwind v4
preset that ships with the starter, so your UI and MDX components stay in sync.

```yaml filename="canopy.yml" {12-18}
theme:
  accentColor: indigo # Radix accent name
  grayColor: slate # Radix gray name
  appearance: light # light | dark
```

- **`accentColor`** drives buttons, links, checkboxes, and focus rings.
- **`grayColor`** sets the base neutral ramp used for page backgrounds, card borders, and typography.
- **`appearance`** flips the design token ramp (`light` or `dark`).

## Beyond the base tokens

Use the standard CSS entry point (`app/styles/main.css`) or Tailwind utilities to extend the theme.

```css filename="app/styles/main.css"
@layer properties {
  :root,
  :host {
    --font-sans: system-ui, "Segoe UI", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    --font-serif: "Fraunces", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif;
    --font-mono: "IBM Plex Mono", "ui-monospace", Menlo, Consolas, monospace;
    --default-font-family: var(--font-serif);
  }
}

@utility max-w-content {
  max-width: 1080px;
}

@utility max-w-wide {
  max-width: 1300px;
}

@layer base {
  html {
    font-size: 110%;
    font-weight: 300;
  }

  body {
    background: var(--color-gray-50);
    color: var(--color-gray-900);
  }
}
```

The Tailwind config already imports the Canopy preset (`@canopy-iiif/app/ui/tailwind-config`).
Extend it if you need custom tokens, plugins, or safelisted classes.

<ThemeShowcase />

## Component-level tweaks

Many components exposed by `@canopy-iiif/app/ui` accept `className` props so you can apply scoped
changes without forking the shared styles. For example:

```mdx
<Button className="rounded-full px-6" href="/search" label="Browse works" />
```

Pair targeted overrides like the one above with global theme changes for a cohesive look.
